docs.lead_paragraph: I don’t need an ad campaign to tell me about the challenges of parenthood. I need support, not stereotypes and shame.
docs.snippet: I don’t need an ad campaign to tell me about the challenges of parenthood. I need support, not stereotypes and shame.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shame is an essential ingredient of a healthy society, particularly a liberal one.

headline.seo: A Case for Shaming Teenage Pregnancy
headline.main: Shame Is Not a Four-Letter Word
headline.print_headline: Shame Is Not a Four-Letter Word

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Brookings Institution fellow Richard V Reeves makes case for usefulness of shame as a deterrent; contends shame is essential ingredient of a healthy society, particularly a liberal one; cites advertisements shamefully pointing out destructive effects of teen pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Shame is an essential ingredient of a healthy society, particularly a liberal one.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shortly after Arkansas adopted the country’s most stringent abortion limits, North Dakota’s Legislature approved a bill blocking the procedure as early as six weeks into pregnancy.

headline.seo: North Dakota Approves Bill to Ban Abortions as Early as 6 Weeks
headline.main: Bill in North Dakota Bans Abortion After Heartbeat Is Found
headline.print_headline: North Dakota Approves Stricter Ban On Abortions

docs.abstract: North Dakota’s Legislature approves bill banning most abortions as early as six weeks into pregnancy; action comes shortly after Arkansas adopted country's most stringent abortion limits, banning procedure at 12 weeks of pregnancy; Gov Jack Dalrymple has not said whether he will sign bill into law.
docs.snippet: Shortly after Arkansas adopted the country’s most stringent abortion limits, North Dakota’s Legislature approved a bill blocking the procedure as early as six weeks into pregnancy.
